Officers from Ukraine‚Äôs Cyberpolice unit and Main Investigative Department, working with the Prosecutor General‚Äôs Office, have seized nine cryptocurrency exchanges, the National Police of Ukraine announced. Representatives of the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) also took part in what Ukrainian authorities described as a ‚Äúmulti-level international operation.‚Äù

entry.title: Bitcoin Climbs Above $29,000 As US Regional Banking Crisis Deepens
entry.summary:
The Bitcoin price has climbed back above $29,000 and the reason is like poetry. Just hours after U.S. Federal Reserve (Fed) Chairman Jerome Powell assured the public at yesterday‚Äôs FOMC meeting that the U.S. banking system is safe and sound, numerous regional banks have once again come under heavy pressure.
Regional Banks Still Under Heavy Pressure
Los Angeles-based PacWest (PACW) plunged about 60% in after-hours trading. The regional bank is rumored to be looking for a buyer and considering other strategic options, Bloomberg reported.
When this was announced, the stock plummeted because it‚Äôs clear to investors that either PACW will be sold off at a massive discount or big banks will let the regional bank collapse and then buy it from the FDIC for a pittance. According to Bloomberg, ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ex-Coinbase Exec Balaji Srinivasan Closes Out $1 Million Bitcoin Bet
entry.summary:
Former Chief Technology Officer at Coinbase, Balaji Srinivasan, closed out early a bet that the price of bitcoin would hit $1 million by mid-June amid hyperinflation of the U.S. dollar. Srinivasan paid a total of $1.5 million, more than the initially committed $1 million, with two-thirds of the money donated to two organizations.
Former Coinbase CTO Settles $1 Million Bet on Bitcoin Ahead of Time
Balaji Srinivasan, the ex-chief tech officer of U.S. crypto exchange Coinbase, has closed his million-dollar Bitcoin bet with the pseudonymous Twitter pundit James Medlock. On Tuesday, Srinivasan announced on his website and social media that he has settled the apparently losing bet ahead of time.
Medlock made the bet on March 16 when he tweeted: ‚ÄúI‚Äôll bet anyone $1 million dollars that the ‚Ä¶

Kennedy Jr. has warned that ‚Äúthe banking collapse is the tip of an economic mega-crisis,‚Äù emphasizing that ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not just the banks.‚Äù He also slammed President Joe Biden‚Äôs crypto mining tax proposal. ‚ÄúIt is a mistake for the U.S. government to hobble the industry and drive innovation elsewhere,‚Äù Kennedy stressed.
Looming Economic ‚ÄòMega-Crisis‚Äô
Robert F. Kennedy Jr., who launched his presidential campaign last month, issued several warnings this week about the state of the U.S. economy, the banking crisis, and President Joe Biden‚Äôs cryptocurrency mining tax proposal. He is a nephew of President John F. Kennedy and a son of U.S. attorney general Robert F. Kennedy.
Firstly, Kennedy warned about an incoming economic ‚Äúmega-crisis.‚Äù He tweeted Tuesday:‚Ä¶

The Fed‚Äôs rate hike has sparked a flurry of activity on Twitter, with precious metals trending and generating numerous discussions and tweets. entry.title: Crypto Exchange Coinbase Faces Legal Action Over Biometric Data Collection
entry.summary:
The Nasdaq-listed cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase has been accused of ‚Äúwrongfully‚Äù profiting from its users‚Äô facial and fingerprint scans. ‚ÄúCoinbase collects, stores, possesses, otherwise obtains, uses, and disseminates its users‚Äô biometric data to, amongst other things, further enhance Coinbase and its online ‚Äòapp-based‚Äô Platform,‚Äù a proposed class action lawsuit details.
Coinbase ‚ÄòWrongfully Profits‚Äô From Users‚Äô Facial and Fingerprint Scans
A proposed class action lawsuit, filed Monday in the Northern District of California, alleges that the Nasdaq-listed cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase (Nasdaq: COIN) illegally collects face templates and fingerprints of its customers in violation of Illinois‚Äô biometric privacy law.
Plaintiff Michael Massel, a Coinbase customer, explained that th‚Ä¶

entry.title: U.S. SEC Changes Its Mind on Officially Labeling Digital Assets
entry.summary: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) took one small step backwards in regulating the crypto sector on Wednesday, when it deleted what would have been its first formal definition of ‚Äúdigital asset‚Äù from its latest hedge fund rule.

entry.title: Bitdeer Partners With Druk Holding & Investments For Bitcoin Mining Operation In Kingdom Of Bhutan
entry.summary:
The mining operations will be ‚Äúcarbon-free‚Äù according to the firms and the first expansion by Bitdeer into Asia.
Bitdeer Technologies Group and Druk Holding & Investments have partnered to develop a 100% carbon-free digital asset mining operation in the Kingdom of Bhutan. According to a press release sent to Bitcoin Magazine, the partnership aims to help accelerate Bhutan's digital transformation and economic diversification, while expanding Bitdeer's global footprint. The two firms will establish a closed-end fund worth up to $500 million, which will launch in May 2023. Bitdeer will serve as the general partner, while DHI will act as a strategic limited partner. ‚ÄúThe Partnership is expected to create local jobs in areas ranging from engineering to project management, supervisory and supportive functions,‚Äù the press release said. ‚ÄúAt the same time, the Partnership is expected to generate economic activity and foreign-currency-denominated revenue for local communities and the country.‚Äù Bitdeer's Chairman, Jihan Wu, said, "We are excited to be working alongside DHI in accessing Bhutan's zero-emissions power to sustainably enable the blockchain technologies that will eventually form an immutable bedrock for a global store of value." ‚ÄúWe are thrilled to partner with Bitdeer on this important development for DHI.‚Äù Ujjwal Deep Dahal, CEO of Druk Holding and Investments, commented. "DHI exists for the betterment of the lives of Bhutanese people today and for generations to follow." Bitdeer currently operates data centers in Northern Europe and North America. As the press release notes, the upcoming carbon-free bitcoin mining operation in Bhutan will mark a crucial expansion into Asia for Bitdeer, which ‚Äúwill enable Bitdeer to tap into Asia's abundant resources, contributing to the flourishing regional ecosystem.‚Äù

entry.title: Only In Crypto: People Receive Airdrop Worth 7 ETH By Pasting Address On Twitter
entry.summary:
There have been some unbelievable success stories in the crypto community since its inception due to how rapidly coins can climb in value. However, when it seems like we have seen it all, something else happens to remind participants in the space that anything is possible with crypto. This time around, it is a 5-figure airdrop that was given to individuals who did nothing else but copy and paste their wallet addresses under a Twitter post.
Paste A Wallet Address On Twitter To Get 7 ETH
On April 29, a Twitter user with over 266,000 followers known as @wsbmod made a post asking people to paste their Ethereum wallets. The vague post did not say anything about an airdrop or even if there was going to be a token. Nevertheless, some people did submit their wallets from what can be presumed t‚Ä¶

entry.title: Biden‚Äôs Proposed 30% Tax On Cryptocurrency Mining Is A Bad Idea Says US Presidential Aspirant
entry.summary:
Robert .F. Kennedy Jr, a presidential aspirant in the upcoming US 2024 elections, had not minced words when he called sitting president Biden‚Äôs proposed 30% tax on cryptocurrency mining a ‚ÄúBad Idea‚Äù.
Robert, who believes cryptocurrencies led by Bitcoin and its technologies are a major innovation engine, also stated that it is a mistake for the US government to drive this new technological innovation elsewhere.
A report from the official website of the Whitehouse dated May 2, 2023, had earlier headlined the DAME Tax, which sees to it that crypto miners, including corporate mining companies, ‚Äúpay for the costs they impose on others.‚Äù While this update had stirred reactions from the crypto community, Robert Kennedy Jr has had more to say about this development.

entry.title: gm: Meet Immunefi's White Hat Whisperer
entry.summary: When Web3 bug bounty platform Immunefi launched two years ago, CEO and founder Mitchell Amador says the bug bounties weren't great and adoption was slow. But the tides started to turn because even if exploiting a smart contract nets a bigger payday than a bounty, it comes with a huge drawback. "There's a ton of risk when you engage in this, you know, wantonly criminal behavior and steal $200 million from someone else," he said. "There's no way someone's not going to come looking."

entry.title: gm: Marco Santori
entry.summary: There's no doubt that the SEC dealt Kraken‚Äîand the outlook for crypto staking products in the U.S.‚Äîa big blow when it announced a $30 million settlement and ordered the company to stop offering the service to its customers in the states in February. Now Marco Santori, the company's chief legal officer, says the exchange is eager to move on from it. That means reckoning with a really challenging regulatory environment and growing its customer base overseas. And as Santori quips: "Kraken's master account application has not yet been rejected."

entry.title: gm: Arthur Hayes Says Crypto Failures Are A Sign of The System Cleansing Itself
entry.summary: Arthur Hayes says the speed at which projects like Terra grow and implode is a feature of the crypto industry, not a bug. He founded crypto exchange Bitmex in 2014 and then became the original crypto bad boy. In 2021 the DOJ charged him in with violating the U.S. Bank Secrecy Act for not implementing an anti-money laundering program at Bitmex. He plead guilty and was sentenced to two years probation and six months of home detention. In fact, he was still sporting an ankle bracelet on a recent cover of New York Magazine. Now he's living in Singapore, offering up his views on the crypto industry with long form, meme-filled essays, and still thinks the crypto industry will save investors from what he calls a broken banking system. "I don't care if you're capitalist or you're a communist. Everybody put on a lot of debt. We've passed the point where that debt is becoming useful," he said. "And therefore everyone is going to take an L unless they get some crypto or some gold‚Äîsome hard asset that's outside of the traditional banking system."

entry.title: Brycent on Meeting Gary Vaynerchuk through Web3 Gaming
entry.summary: XSET gamer and content creator Brycent tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how entrepreneur and VeeFriends creator Gary Vaynerchuk first reached out to him.
